preface.title: OpenStack API Reference
preface.para: Use the OpenStack APIs in your OpenStack cloud: Identity service, Compute and Compute extensions, Image service, Volumes, and Object Storage. You must install the packages for each API separately. After you authenticate through the Identity service API, you can use the other APIs and extensions to launch server instances, create images, assign metadata to instances and images, create containers and objects, and complete other actions in your OpenStack cloud.
To get started with the APIs, see the API Quick Start Guide. For detailed information, read descriptions or specifications for each API.

chapter.title: Identity
chapter.para: Gets an authentication token that permits access to the Compute API for 24 hours. The version of the Identity API is 2.0.

chapter.title: Compute
chapter.para: Launches virtual machines based on the images uploaded to the system. Also, connects to a server instance securely through SSH once it starts and reboots or resizes server instances as needed. API v1.1 is identical to API v2.

chapter.title: Compute Extensions
chapter.para: Adds capabilities to the Compute API beyond those defined in the core API. Use extensions to add features, MIME types, actions, states, headers, parameters, and resources to the core API. Query the Compute API to list available extensions with a GET request to v2/extensions.

section.title: Server - Extended Create
section.para: Shows extra information when you create a server.

section.title: Servers - Multiple Create
section.para: Creates multiple servers with an optional reservation ID.

section.title: Server Console Output
section.para: Gets the output from the console log for a server.

section.title: Server Diagnostics
section.para: Gets the usage data for a server.

section.title: Server VNC Console
section.para: Accesses a VNC console for a specified server.

section.title: Server Password
section.para: This extension retrieves and resets the encrypted admin password set through metadata service.

section.title: Server Start/Stop
section.para: Starts and stops a server.

section.title: Server Rescue
section.para: Rescues or unrescues a server.

section.title: Server Actions - List or Get Details
section.para: Permits all users to list available actions for a specified server. Permits administrators to get details for a specified action for a specified server.

section.title: Server Actions (Admin)
section.para: Permits administrators to perform actions on a server.

section.title: Disk Config
section.para: Extends servers and images with a diskConfig attribute.

section.title: Server Force Delete/Restore
section.para: Restores or force-deletes a server when you deploy nova with deferred delete on.

section.title: Extended Instance Status
section.para: Adds vm_state, task_state, and power_state to detailed server responses.

section.title: Extended Server Attributes
section.para: Adds metadata to and shows additional metadata for servers.

section.title: Fixed IPs
section.para: Shows data for a specified fixed IP, such as host name, CIDR, and address. Also, reserves or frees a fixed IP.

section.title: Floating IPs
section.para: Assigns and allocates floating IP addresses to instances that run in an OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Floating IPs Bulk
section.para: Bulk creates, deletes, and lists floating IPs. By default, the pool is named nova. Use the os-floating-ip-pools extension to view available pools.

section.title: Floating IP DNS
section.para: Manages DNS records associated with IP addresses allocated by the Floating IPs extension. Requests are dispatched to a DNS driver selected at startup.

section.title: Floating IP Pools
section.para: Manages groups of floating IPs.

section.title: Server IP Type
section.para: This extension shows the type of the IPs assigned to an instance, either fixed or floating.

section.title: Host Aggregates
section.para: Creates and manages host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the cloud provider.

section.title: Agents
section.para: Creates, updates, and deletes guest agents. Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking, or run other applications or scripts in the guest while it runs. This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service provider uses the Xen driver.

section.title: Cloudpipe
section.para: Manages virtual vpns for projects.

section.title: Flavor Management
section.para: Creates and deletes flavors.

section.title: Flavors - Extra Data
section.para: Returns extra attributes with flavor objects, including swap, rxtx_factor, and OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral.

section.title: Keypairs
section.para: Generates, imports, and deletes SSH keys.

section.title: Hosts
section.para: Manages physical hosts.

section.title: Hypervisors
section.para: Displays extra statistical information from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Networks
section.para: Shows network information and deletes networks. Also, disassociates a network from a project if you use vlan mode.

section.title: Quota Sets
section.para: Permits administrators, depending on policy settings, to view quotas for a tenant and view and update default quotas.

section.title: Scheduler Hints
section.para: Provides information directly to the scheduler when you create a server.

section.title: Security Groups
section.para: Creates, modifies, and deletes security groups and rules.

section.title: Simple Usage
section.para: Reports statistics on compute and storage resources.

section.title: Virtual Interfaces
section.para: Lists the virtual interfaces for a specified server instance.

section.title: Used Limits
section.para: Extends limits to show the usage of per project limits. Shows information such as RAM or instance quotas usage.

chapter.title: Image
chapter.para: Loads images for use at launch time by the Compute API. Some cloud implementations do not expose this API and offer pre-tested images only. Also, assigns metadata to images.

section.title: Volume
section.para: Manages volumes and snapshots for use with the Volume API (nova-volume or cinder services).

section.title: Volume Extension to Compute
section.para: Manages volumes and snapshots for use with the Compute API.

section.title: Volume Attachments
section.para: Attaches volumes created through the volume API to server instances. Also, lists volume attachments for a server instance, gets volume details for a volume attachment, and deletes a volume attachment.

chapter.title: Object Storage
chapter.para: Manages the accounts, containers and objects in the object storage system.
